author: arkenan
content:
Hi everyone! I'm Tom√°s, one of the devs building a new consensus client in elixir for the EPF. We can already see that the spec tests will be extremely useful in the process, but we wanted to get some feedback on how to use them. We have two options:
1. Building the core algorithms for phase 0 until the phase 0 spec tests run, and then move on to the next one, so we can focus on one set of features at a time.
2. Starting with the later test specs directly and just selecting subsets of tests to run at a time.

The advantage of the first option is that it's simpler and more control, but at the same time, that would mean implementing the changes for a phase, and then reworking and possibly rewriting parts for the next one each time.

What do you think? Did you encounter this decision? What are your thoughts about it?
